column1: Babrala is a town and nagar panchayat in Sambhal district in the state of Uttar Pradesh
column2: India. Babrala is located on NH 509. Babrala is located near Narora Atomic Power Station. The prestigious Tata Chemicals Limited (Acquired by Yara Chemicals) Plant is also located in Babrala with an installed capacity of 864
column3: 600 tonnes of urea per year. There is a prominent DAV Fertilizer Public School in Indira Dham
column5: Babrala. Total Area 6.18 sq km. There is Raj Ghat of Ganga River in Babrala. Maa Ganga Jan Sewa Samiti
column6: Babrala is organising daily Ganga Aarti at Rajghat
column7: Babrala.lohiya convent school is also located in babrala

column1: Babrala is located at 28.27°N 78.4°E﻿ / 28.27; 78.4. It has an average elevation of 177 metres (580 feet).

column3: 447. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Babrala has an average literacy rate of 72%
column4: more than the national average of 59.5%; with 80% of the males and 76% of females literate. 17% of the population is under 6 years of age.
